info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 3 at 6:25AM CDT until May 3 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Okaloosa and Santa Rosa.
* WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Walton Beach, Destin, Gulf Breeze, Mary Esther, Oriole Beach, Navarre, Cinco Bayou, Navarre Beach, Pensacola Beach, Wynnehaven Beach, Harper, Woodlawn Beach and Villa Sabine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING
